message_1: Consider a Morse-Smale complex with seven critical points, consisting of two index-0, one index-1, two index-2 and two index-3 critical points. What is the Euler characteristic of the Morse-Smale complex?
message_2:
The Euler characteristic of a Morse-Smale complex can be computed using the alternating sum of the number of critical points of each index. In this case, we have:

χ = (# of index-0) - (# of index-1) + (# of index-2) - (# of index-3)

Plugging in the given numbers of critical points, we get:

χ = (2) - (1) + (2) - (2)

χ = 1

So the Euler characteristic of the Morse-Smale complex is 1.
